title: A data package with the results of a travel and well-being survey conducted in Santiago in 2016
text: notebook read preprocess raw data collected paper-based survey conducted face--face Santiago 2016 Dr. Beatriz Mella-Lira. survey collected information wide range travel-related issues (socio-demographics, health-related, perceptions travel behaviour, travel choices planning, social interaction factors, built environment, ). data collection considered quota-sampling method based information Pre-census 2012, total 451 persons. access raw material used generating dataset, first need learn use repository RStudio. project repository utilizes {renv} package establish reproducible environment. designed facilitate work bSantiago dataset, titled Reproducible Dataset Study Transportation, Residential Context, Well-Santiago, Chile R. repository offers necessary setup recreate environment used generating dataset. encompasses specific version R packages utilized dataset.

title: A data package with the results of a travel and well-being survey conducted in Santiago in 2016
text: Begin installing R programming language, ensuring select appropriate version operating system. can find R core package : https://cran.rstudio.com/. Install RStudio, ensuring choose correct version operating system. RStudio serves Integrated Development Environment (IDE) can downloaded : https://www.rstudio.com/products/rstudio/download/. ’re using Windows, download run Rtools43 installer link: https://cran.r-project.org/bin/windows/Rtools/rtools43/rtools.html. Mac users, may need install Xcode, though can’t verify since don’t access Macs. can find information : https://mac.r-project.org/tools/.

title: A data package with the results of a travel and well-being survey conducted in Santiago in 2016
text: Now instructions use raw material generate necessary information based research objectives. opening new R Markdown file can go following steps: Open New R Markdown File: RStudio, go “File” menu select “New File,” choose “R Markdown” dropdown menu. Alternatively, can use keyboard shortcut Ctrl + Shift + N (Windows) Cmd + Shift + N (Mac). Select appropriate template list options. Since ’re working bSantiago dataset, choose template relevant analysis reporting needs. example, might select template data exploration, analysis, report generation. Provide name R Markdown file choose location save . Accessing Dataset: R Markdown file open, can start accessing bSantiago dataset. may involve loading dataset R environment using appropriate functions read.csv() readxlsx() depending format dataset including CSV Excel. Ensure dataset file located directory accessible R session. may need set working directory using setwd() use relative file paths access dataset file. code loading dataset (Answers), survey (questions dictionary) communa file data frame including geographic information respondents survey. Preprocessing Dataset: dataset loaded depending nature analysis research objectives, may need preprocess dataset conducting analysis. may include tasks data cleaning, data transformation, data merging, data aggregation. Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA): dataset preprocessed, can perform exploratory data analysis gain insights data distribution, relationships variables, potential patterns trends.
code: SantiagoSurvey <- readxl::read_xlsx(paste0(here(), "/data-raw/SantiagoSurvey2016.xlsx")) SantiagoSurvey_csv <- readr::read_csv(paste0(here(), "/data-raw/SantiagoSurvey2016.csv"))  SantiagoSurvey_dicxl <- readxl::read_xlsx(paste0(here(), "/data-raw/SantiagoSurvey2016-Survey-Questions-and-Dictionary.xlsx")) SantiagoSurvey_diccsv <- readr::read_csv(paste0(here(), "/data-raw/SantiagoSurvey2016-Survey-Questions-and-Dictionary.csv"))  comunas_1 <- st_read(paste0(here(), "/data-raw/comunas_1/comunas_1Polygon.shp"))

text: completing data preprocessing steps R Markdown document, might want knit document produce final report output. ’s can knit R Markdown document handle common scenarios: Knitting HTML, PDF, Formats: knit R Markdown document, click “Knit” button RStudio toolbar. Choose output format want (HTML, PDF, Word, etc.) dropdown menu. RStudio execute R code chunks document render output specified format. Handling Errors: errors knitting process, RStudio display error messages console. Review error messages identify fix issues R Markdown document R code. Viewing Output: knitting process complete, RStudio open output file new tab window. can view output file directly RStudio open default web browser PDF viewer. following steps considerations, can successfully knit R Markdown document generate final report output based data preprocessing analysis.

what: A data package with the results of a travel and well-being survey conducted in Santiago in 2016 — Santiago-package
title: A data package with the results of a travel and well-being survey conducted in Santiago in 2016 — Santiago-package
text: data package based paper-based survey conducted face--face Santiago 2016. goal Santiago contribute psychological impacts travelers examining feelings stress users active motorized modes transportation.Furthermore, also investigates importance travelers attach feelings stress.package contains different datasets namely Individual characteristics (IC), Health (H), Feelings emotions (FE), Reason planning decision (RPD), Social interaction (SI), Nature sustainability (NS), ITC shifting (), Build environment(), Traveling work (TW).

Levels stress; variable ordered factor five levels, "IMPORTANT", "SLIGHTLY IMPORTANT", "MODERATELY IMPORTANT", "IMPORTANT", "IMPORTANT" H_Imp_effort importance respondents assign aspects? Levels physical effort; variable ordered factor five levels, "IMPORTANT", "SLIGHTLY IMPORTANT", "MODERATELY IMPORTANT", "IMPORTANT", "IMPORTANT" H_Imp_prox importance respondents assign aspects? Levels proximity transport users; variable ordered factor five levels, "IMPORTANT", "SLIGHTLY IMPORTANT", "MODERATELY IMPORTANT", "IMPORTANT", "IMPORTANT" H_Imp_contam importance respondents assign aspects? Levels (perceived) air pollution; variable ordered factor five levels, "IMPORTANT", "SLIGHTLY IMPORTANT", "MODERATELY IMPORTANT", "IMPORTANT", "IMPORTANT" H_Imp_safety importance respondents assign aspects? Levels safety; variable ordered factor five levels, "IMPORTANT", "SLIGHTLY IMPORTANT", "MODERATELY IMPORTANT", "IMPORTANT", "IMPORTANT" H_Imp_comfort importance respondents assign aspects? Levels comfort; variable ordered factor five levels, "IMPORTANT", "SLIGHTLY IMPORTANT", "MODERATELY IMPORTANT", "IMPORTANT", "IMPORTANT"

text: @format data frame 451 rows 9 variables: ID Unique identifier respondent IS_Shiftmode respondents shift transport modes usual trips?; variable factor two levels, "YES", "" IS_Qualityshift YES previous question, quality interchanges?; variable ordered factor five levels, "POOR", "FAIR", "GOOD", "GOOD", "EXCELLENT" IS_Waitingtime respondents assess regular trips terms : Waiting times; variable ordered factor five levels, "POOR", "FAIR", "GOOD", "GOOD", "EXCELLENT" IS_Shift_time respondents assess regular trips terms : Time shifts; variable ordered factor five levels, "POOR", "FAIR", "GOOD", "GOOD", "EXCELLENT" IS_Travel_time respondents assess regular trips terms : Travel time; variable ordered factor five levels, "POOR", "FAIR", "GOOD", "GOOD", "EXCELLENT" IS_Difficulty_modechange main aspect makes shifts difficult?; variable factor six levels, "Bad physical conection sidewalks", "long shifts", "Uncomfortable shifting", "Bad infrastructure waiting times", "Unsafe shifting ", "previous ones","" IS_Techtool respondents access technology tools smartphones internet, can view information transportation services?; variable factor two levels, "YES", "" IS_Info_techtool assess level technological information available see transportation alternatives? (eg smartphone applications, internet, signs); variable ordered factor five levels, "POOR", "FAIR", "GOOD", "GOOD", "EXCELLENT" IS_Imp_techtool important respondents access technological information usual trips?; variable ordered factor five levels, "IMPORTANT", "SLIGHTLY IMPORTANT", "MODERATELY IMPORTANT", "IMPORTANT", "IMPORTANT"

(eg hybrid buses, electric cars, public bicycles); variable ordered factor five levels, "POOR", "FAIR", "GOOD", "GOOD", "EXCELLENT" NS_Imp_sustainmode important respondents access sustainable modes transport?; variable ordered factor five levels, "IMPORTANT", "SLIGHTLY IMPORTANT", "MODERATELY IMPORTANT", "IMPORTANT", "IMPORTANT" NS_Willing_pay_sustainmode respondents willing spend transportation gain access sustainable modes?; variable factor two levels, "YES", "" NS_Pay_sustaintype respondents' previous response positive, indication much transportation expense increase; variable ordered factor three levels, "5-15%", "15-30%", "30% " NS_Imp_tree indication important improving following aspects public transport routes: Presence trees; variable ordered factor five levels, "IMPORTANT", "SLIGHTLY IMPORTANT", "MODERATELY IMPORTANT", "IMPORTANT", "IMPORTANT" NS_Imp_park indication important improving following aspects public transport routes: Access parks; variable ordered factor five levels, "IMPORTANT", "SLIGHTLY IMPORTANT", "MODERATELY IMPORTANT", "IMPORTANT", "IMPORTANT" NS_Imp_imprv_sustainmode indication important improving following aspects public transport routes: Access sustainable transport modes; variable ordered factor five levels, "IMPORTANT", "SLIGHTLY IMPORTANT", "MODERATELY IMPORTANT", "IMPORTANT", "IMPORTANT" NS_Imp_increasesusmodes indication important improving following aspects public transport routes: Broaden supply sustainable transport modes; variable ordered factor five levels, "IMPORTANT", "SLIGHTLY IMPORTANT", "MODERATELY IMPORTANT", "IMPORTANT", "IMPORTANT"
